Title: List of most usability evaluation in mobile application: A systematic literature review
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sunardi, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Desak, G.G.F.P., BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Gintoro, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Mobile application is one of the most growth technology that can help people do better. Mobile applications nowadays have created tremendously compared with the website. Usability issues will be questioning as a measurement of mobile application accepted in the market. This paper reports on the systematic literature review (SLR) from 2010 up to 2020 to investigate how usability evaluation of mobile applications will change along the time through the evaluation of mobile devices. From 168 paper retrieved, 32 papers are selected to find the relevance of the research question. The result shows several famous indicators of usability evaluation, which are effectiveness, efficiency, and user satisfaction. There are new inclusions that come as new indicators such as error, learnability, memorability, simplicity, and cognitive load. This result indicates the need for future research especially for new rapid applications created © 2020 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Information management; Usability engineering; Cognitive loads; Growth technologies; Mobile applications; Research questions; Systematic literature review; Systematic literature review (SLR); Usability evaluation; User satisfaction; Mobile computing

Title: A comparative study of teaching styles in online learning environment
Source title: Proceedings of 2017 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2017
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Information Systems Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Titan, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Ferdianto, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Desak, G.G.F.P., Information Systems Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Lena, Information Systems Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Because of its flexibility, nowadays online learning serves as a promising alternative for busy people in continuing their educations. This alternative offers you online learning interactions through synchronous and asynchronous session, which usually accommodated by learning management systems or another technology platform and applications. Basically, in online learning environment, the learning interaction will have a transition from teacher-dependent to learner-dependent, but it still can't be concluded that the succession in online learning doesn't affected by the teaching styles of the instructor. This study is aimed to see whether the teaching styles of the instructors will have an impact in academic achievement of the students. The study was conducted by a comparative study towards two classes with two different instructors, which have their own teaching styles. The result said that the class with the more active and responsive instructors has a better results in score. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: academic achievement; learning interaction; online learning; teaching styles
Index Keywords: Computer aided instruction; Information management; Online systems; Teaching; Academic achievements; Comparative studies; Learning interactions; Learning management system; Online learning; Online learning environment; Teaching styles; Technology platforms; E-learning
